title: Are Burberry Scarves in Style? What to Know Before You Buy One

steps.title: Yes, Burberry scarves are timeless pieces that are always in style.
steps.content: Yes, Burberry scarves are timeless pieces that are always in style. This neutral scarf matches practically any outfit, making it a cold-weather staple. Plus, the Burberry plaid pattern is instantly recognizable, signaling to others that you’re posh enough to wear a designer item. [1] X Research source When someone refers to a Burberry scarf, they’re usually referring to the Classic Check Cashmere Scarf in Archive Beige, which is a unisex style. Burberry does sell scarves in other patterns and materials, as well, but they aren’t as iconic as the Classic Check.

steps.title: It is, but you’ll spend a good chunk of change for it.
steps.content: It is, but you’ll spend a good chunk of change for it. The Classic Check Cashmere Scarf in Archive Beige sells for $470 USD on the Burberry website. [2] X Research source It’s a high-quality piece that you can wear for years to come, so if you’re into designer items and live in an area with cold weather, a Burberry scarf is a nice addition to your wardrobe. Look for a pre-owned Burberry scarf if you want to save a bit of money and still get the real deal. Always avoid knock-offs, which are usually of poor quality and are a detriment to the fashion industry.

steps.title: They’re handmade in Scotland using the finest materials.
steps.content: They’re handmade in Scotland using the finest materials. All cashmere scarves are woven on looms at a 200-year-old mill. It takes 30 steps to create a single scarf, including washing the fabric with water from a spring in the Scottish countryside. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Burberry is a high-end luxury brand.
steps.content: Burberry is a high-end luxury brand. In addition to the materials and expertise, you’re also paying for the Burberry name. The company was founded in 1856 and has a long history in the fashion industry. The classic check pattern of the iconic Burberry scarf was trademarked in the 1920s! [4] X Research source

steps.title: A Burberry scarf will last a lifetime if you take care of it.
steps.content: A Burberry scarf will last a lifetime if you take care of it. These scarves are woven with high-quality cashmere and are made to last. So long as you don’t wash the scarf, it should remain in great shape. Burberry even offers professional aftercare services in the event that your item needs to be repaired. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Look for a blurred appearance.
steps.content: Look for a blurred appearance. A real Burberry scarf has a blurred look to it because of the brushing process during production. In contrast, knock-offs likely have clear demarcation lines where the colors change.

steps.title: Ensure all the font weights on the tags are the same.
steps.content: Ensure all the font weights on the tags are the same. The tags on fake Burberry scarves are often low-quality, so the size and thickness of the letters may be uneven. On a real Burberry scarf, each character is in the same font style and weight. [6] X Research source The tags contain information about the brand, where the scarf was made, and how to care for it.

steps.title: Check for thick, even tassels.
steps.content: Check for thick, even tassels. The tassels at the end of a real Burberry scarf are bulky. On a knock-off, these tend to be thin and stringy. [7] X Research source

steps.title: Make sure the scarf comes in a box with an extra tag.
steps.content: Make sure the scarf comes in a box with an extra tag. When you buy a real Burberry scarf, it will be presented to you in a box with an extra Burberry tag, a paper containing Burberry’s contact information, and the receipt. [8] X Research source

steps.title: Purchase Burberry items only from authorized retailers.
steps.content: Purchase Burberry items only from authorized retailers. To know you’re getting the real deal, buy your scarf from the manufacturer. You can order a Burberry scarf from the Burberry website, or pick one up at Harrods, Saks Fifth Avenue, Nordstrom, Neiman Marcus, Macy’s, or other high-end department stores. To find a store in your area, go to https://us.burberry.com/store-locator/ .

steps.title: Opt for a monochromatic outfit to make your scarf the star of the show.
steps.content: Opt for a monochromatic outfit to make your scarf the star of the show. For a sleek look, choose pieces in a single shade and add your Burberry scarf for a pop of color. [9] X Research source For instance, pair a little black dress, black trench coat, and black pumps with your scarf. There are tons of ways to tie your scarf to create different looks, as well. [10] X Research source

steps.title: Pair your Burberry scarf with a Burberry trench for a classic look.
steps.content: Pair your Burberry scarf with a Burberry trench for a classic look. The check pattern on the lining of the khaki Burberry trench was the inspiration for the scarf. If you want to look like a million bucks, choose a top and slacks in neutral, solid colors. [11] X Expert Source Dina Scherer Wardrobe Stylist & Personal Shopper Expert Interview. 24 August 2021. Add a pair of dress shoes, your Burberry scarf, and your Burberry trench.

steps.title: Dress down the scarf with jeans.
steps.content: Dress down the scarf with jeans. To create a more laid-back vibe, slip into your favorite pair of jeans and a long-sleeve shirt. Add a coat in a neutral color and layer your Burberry scarf on top! There are tons of different looks you can create with a Burberry scarf. [12] X Expert Source Dina Scherer Wardrobe Stylist & Personal Shopper Expert Interview. 24 August 2021. Check out How to Wear a Burberry Scarf for more ideas!

steps.title: Keep it clean and dry.
steps.content: Keep it clean and dry. Take care to keep your scarf away from humidity, liquids, and intense light or heat. [13] X Research source The manufacturer does not recommend washing a cashmere scarf, even by hand. If you do spill something on it, take it to a dry-cleaner for a professional to handle. Check the care tag on your scarf for additional information.
